GAME GUIDELINES FOR VOLLEYBALL ON 9-10-20
With the current outbreak in our Puxico community, Thursday night’s game will be for guests with family passes that have been issued to each player, for each team, and ONLY 50 general admission fans. Our goal is to provide an education and activities for our students in the safest environment possible. If you are feeling ill, stay at home. If a member of your household has a positive Covid test or you are under quarantine, stay home. We recommend fans to wear a face mask while entering and leaving, to sit with your family group, and to leave space between you and other groups of fans. Fans will be asked to sit in the designated HOME and VISITORS sections. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in this matter. We pray that the spread of this virus will decrease and allow us to have more fans in the stands in the near future. We will try to live stream the game on the Puxico Lady Indians Volleyball Facebook Page.
#GoPuxico

Today, we celebrate "School Lunch Hero Day!" Between preparing healthy food, adhering to strict nutrition standards, navigating student food allergies, and offering service with a smile, Missouri nutrition professionals have a lot on their plate on a “normal” day. Extended building closures during COVID-19 required our food service professionals to quickly be innovative and creative to develop ways to continue feeding the Missouri students who rely on school breakfast and lunch each day.

Join us in recognizing these important team members today!

Stoddard County has been issue a tornado watch currently effective until 11:00 p.m.

We will have the Puxico Activity Center (FEMA Shelter) ready for anyone seeking shelter should conditions worsen.

Please maintain personal distance if you come to the shelter. Try to maintain a distance of 6 feet and spread out accordingly. Do not congregate at the entrance or exits. If you feel ill at all, we will have chairs available for you on the side opposite of the bleachers.

We hope to provide you with a safe shelter area while preventing the spread of viruses or illnesses.

For everyone’s safety and comfort, weapons, alcohol, drugs, and tobacco products are prohibited. Pets are not allowed in the safe room unless they are confined in an owner provided pet carrier.
